German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From Middle High German erlouben, from Old High German irlouben, arlouben, from Proto-Germanic *uzlaubijaną. Cognate with Old English ālīefan, ālȳfan (“to allow”). More at leave (“permission”).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): [ʔɛɐ̯ˈlaʊ̯bm̩], [ʔɛɐ̯ˈlaʊ̯bən]
    audio
    		(file)
  • Hyphenation: er‧lau‧ben

Verb[edit]

erlauben (third-person singular simple present erlaubt, past tense erlaubte, past participle erlaubt, auxiliary haben)

  1. (with dative) to allow; to permit

Synonyms[edit]

  • genehmigen
  • gestatten
  • bewilligen
